segments.text: The scene is almost perfect, with the sunlight and tidy garden out the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, it feels chaotic and unsafe, with water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the woman is lost in her own little world, polishing that plate endlessly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s striking how she doesn’t glance down at her feet or around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching toward the cookie jar like he’s on the brink of a victory.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that stool looks like it could collapse any second; it’s terrifying!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how reckless they are, sneaking cookies right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl seems excited but cautious, hoping for her turn without getting caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just wish someone would intervene before it all turns chaotic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s hard to reconcile the calm outside with the storm brewing inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
